Text: Last modified March 2023
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text:
Categories of personal data we collect
We collect information that identifies, relates to, describes, references, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular California consumer or household (“Personal Data”). As described above, we have collected one or more data types in the following categories of personal data about individuals within the twelve (12) months preceding the effective date of this Privacy Policy:

Categories of information
Identifiers such as a real name postal address, and email address
Any categories of personal data described in Cal. Civ. Code 1798.80(e), such as real name and postal address.
Characteristics of Protected Classifications under California or federal law, such as religion, country of origin, gender, and age.
Commercial information, including records of personal property, products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies.
Internet or Other Electronic Network Activity Information, including but not limited, to browsing history, search history, and information regarding a consumer’s interaction with an internet Web site, application, or advertisement.
Inferences drawn to create a profile, such as predicted views on various issues, politics, and purchases.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Categories of sources of personal data
We obtain the categories of personal data listed above from the following categories of sources:

Individuals responding to opinion surveys taken by third-party market research companies on our behalf.
Data sets licensed from third-party vendors who have lawful access to such information.
Our website, software, and platforms.
Correspondence received through the “Contact Us” link on our website.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Our business and commercial purposes for collecting personal data
We use the personal information we collect for our operational purposes and other purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. Those purposes may include:

Assisting our clients to communicate with adult consumers and registered voters in more relevant and meaningful ways about the topics and issues that matter to them.
Making predictions about audiences with similar characteristics as to how likely the group would be to purchase a certain product or support a specific political candidate.
Undertaking internal research to develop new products and services and to improve our existing products and services.
For our internal operations, such as auditing, analyzing trends, operating our websites, and exercising/defending legal claims.
To comply with our legal obligations, including compliance obligations and cooperating with law enforcement.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: You have the right to ask us to delete the personal data about you we have collected.
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text: You have the right to ask us to correct inaccurate personal data we have about you.
Label: Description of Right to Correct Information

Text:
Non-discrimination
Your privacy rights are important. If you exercise your privacy rights under California law, we will not do any of the following in retaliation:

Deny you goods or services.
Charge you different prices or rates for goods or services, including through the use of discounts or other benefits, or imposing penalties.
Provide you a different level or quality of goods or services.
Suggest that you may receive a different price or rate for goods or services or a different level or quality of goods or services.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

Text: How California residents can submit requests\nIf you are a California resident and you want to submit a request to us regarding your California rights, you can fill out the webform here, contact us at ccpa.information@tunnldata.com, or call us at 1-866-498-2784. You do not have to create an account with us to submit a request.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: If you would like to request that we not sell personal data we have collected about you, please fill out the webform located here.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: If you would like to request that we not sell personal data we have collected about you, please fill out the webform located here. You can also e-mail us a request containing your full name, physical address and telephone number at ccpa.optout@tunnldata.com.\n\nYou may also opt out by calling our dedicated toll-free number 1-866-498-2784 and providing us with your full name, physical address, and telephone number.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text:
Sharing of personal data for targeted advertising
We do not allow others to collect your personal data for targeted advertising  based on your activity on our websites and other sites (a concept sometimes known as “sharing”).
